messages.title: A Green vote will make a difference in York Central
messages.content: Either Labour or the Tories may be the biggest party in parliament after the next election, but having Green MPs will make a massive difference.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will regular the banking system and ensure that expensive bailouts are not needed again.
Protect vital services such as schools, hospitals, care for the elderly and post offices from funding cuts and privatization.
Instead of ID cards and e-borders, implement real policies to help citizenship.
Preserving long-term jobs while ensuring sustainable development is vital.
The Greens will invest in the NHS - and want to see free dental care for everyone.

mentions.tacticalSituation: The Green Party came second in York Central at the last council elections.

issues.economy: We will regular the banking system and ensure that expensive bailouts are not needed again.
issues.education: Protect vital services such as schools from funding cuts and privatization.
issues.environment: Preserving long-term jobs while ensuring sustainable development is vital.
issues.governance: Instead of ID cards and e-borders, implement real policies to help citizenship.
issues.health: Protect vital services such as hospitals, care for the elderly from funding cuts and privatization.
issues.socialWelfare: Protect vital services such as post offices from funding cuts and privatization.

housing.content: Invest in public transport for the 21st century. We'll bring the railways back into public ownership and cut fares.

leaflet.personalStatement: I care about York because it's the place where I live. I would love the chance to make a positive difference as your MP, but I will still be living locally and campaigning when the election is over, whatever the result.

politicalExperience.achievements: Opposed the installation of ticket barriers at York station, supported community mental health facilities, campaigned against 20mph limits on residential streets, opposed the abolishment of the 10p tax band in 2008, actively involved in planning issues.

images.caption: Andy Chase - your Green Candidate for York Central
